section.title: Chargeback Rates
section.para: CloudForms Management Engine provides a default set of rates for calculating chargeback costs, but you can create your own set of computing and storage costs by navigating to menu:Cloud Intelligence[Chargeback] and clicking the [label]#Rates# accordion.
Chargeback costs are computed using a set formula based on hourly cost per unit and hourly usage.

section.title: Memory Used Cost
section.para: Calculating the Memory Used Cost in dollars ($) for a day can be expressed in the following ways:

listitem.para: Memory allocation per hour (in MB) * Hourly Allocation cost per megabyte * Number of Memory Allocation metrics available for the day
Sum of Memory allocation for the day (in MB) * Hourly Allocation cost per megabyte
Sum of Memory allocation for the day (in MB) * Daily Allocation cost per megabyte / 24

example.title: Memory Used Cost
example.para:
In a scenario where 9.29 GB of memory is used in a day with the chargeback rate set at one dollar ($1) per megabyte per day, the Memory Used Cost would be $396.42.
9.29 GB = 9514.08 MB
9514.08 MB * $1 (per MB per day) = $9514.08
$9514.08 / 24 = $396.42 Memory Used Cost

section.title: CPU Total Cost
section.para: The CPU Total Cost is defined as the number of virtual CPUs over the selected interval (hour, day, week, month).

example.title: CPU Total Cost
example.para: In a scenario where 16 CPUs are used in a day with the chargeback rate set at one dollar per CPU per day, the CPU Total Cost would be $16.

listitem.para: 16 CPUs * $1 (per CPU per day) = $16 CPU Total Cost

section.title: CPU Used Cost
section.para: The CPU Used Cost is defined as the average CPU used in MHz over the selected rate interval (hour, day, week, month).

example.title: CPU Used Cost
example.para: In a scenario where 2.5 GHz is used in a day with the chargeback rate set at $0.01 per MHz per day, the CPU Used Cost would be $25.

listitem.para: 2500 MHz * $0.01 (per MHz per day) = $25 CPU Used Cost

section.title: Storage Allocated Cost
section.para: The Storage Allocated Cost is defined as the Allocated Disk Storage in Bytes over the selected rate interval (hour, day, week, month).

example.title: Storage Allocated Cost
example.para: In a scenario where 500 GB are used in a day with the chargeback rate set at $0.10 per GB per day, the Storage Allocated Cost would be $50.

listitem.para: 500 GB * $0.10 (per GB per day) = $50 Storage Allocated Cost

section.title: Storage Total Cost
section.para: The Storage Total Cost is defined as the Used Disk Storage in Bytes over the selected rate interval (hour, day, week, month).

example.title: Storage Total Cost
example.para: In a scenario where 250 GB are used in a day with the chargeback rate set at $0.10 per GB per day, the Storage Total Cost would be $25.

listitem.para: 250 GB * $0.10 (per GB per day) = $25 Storage Total Cost

section.title: Storage Used Cost
section.para: The Storage Used Cost is defined as the Used Disk Storage in Bytes over the selected rate interval (hour, day, week, month).

example.title: Storage Used Cost
example.para: In a scenario where 250 GB are used in a day with the chargeback rate set at $0.10 per GB per day, the Storage Used Cost would be $25.

listitem.para: 250 GB * $0.10 (per GB per day) = $25 Storage Used Cost
